F2D26910DFE401315AD068A86D17958E.description: Students will use the concepts of place and region to explain simple patterns of connections between and among places across the country and the world.

F2D1FEB0DFE401315ACF68A86D17958E.description: Students will develop an understanding of the character and use of regions and the connections between and among them [REGIONS].

F2D1B1C0DFE401315ACE68A86D17958E.description: Students will identify types of human settlement, connections between settlements, and the types of activities found in each.

F2D17280DFE401315ACD68A86D17958E.description: Students will develop an understanding of the diversity of human culture and the unique nature of places [PLACES].

F2D13510DFE401315ACC68A86D17958E.description: Students will distinguish different types of climate and landforms and explain why they occur.

F2D0EC20DFE401315ACB68A86D17958E.description: Students will develop a knowledge of the ways humans modify and respond to the natural environment [ENVIRONMENT].

F2D0A340DFE401315ACA68A86D17958E.description: Students will understand the nature and uses of maps, globes, and other geo-graphics.

F2D04860DFE401315AC968A86D17958E.description: Students will develop a personal geographic framework, or "mental map," and understand the uses of maps and other geo-graphics [MAPS].
